alert.note: Alert for Breathitt; Lee; Owsley; Wolfe (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 19 at 6:48PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Owsley, northwestern Breathitt, Lee and south central Wolfe Counties through 715 PM EDT... At 648 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Lower Buffalo, or near Booneville, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Fincastle and Lone around 655 PM EDT. Athol, Tallega, Canyon Falls, Monica, Copebranch, Jetts Creek, Primrose, Williba, Vada and Turkey around 700 PM EDT. Oakdale, Chenowee, Widecreek, Fillmore, Guerrant, Flat and Mary around 705 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Gentry, Lawson, War Creek, Yeadon, Elkatawa, Pence, Bethany, Hollonville, Lane, Jackson, Fivemile, Frozen Creek, Vancleve, Wilhurst, Inverness, Dumont, Curt and Haddix. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for southeastern Kentucky.
